Waiheke vineyard company Cable Bay Wine found guilty of breaching noise limits, could be fined up to $600,000 https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/waiheke-vineyard-company-cable-bay-wine-found-guilty-of-breaching-noise-limits-could-be-fined-up-to-600000/ 2VEOLKOMZBHMTKMN6C6ZZV6KJM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/waiheke-vineyard-company-cable-bay-wine-found-guilty-of-breaching-noise-limits-could-be-fined-up-to-600000/ 2VEOLKOMZBHMTKMN6C6ZZV6KJM/ Lane NicholsThe vineyard was earlier acquitted after blaming noise readings on 'chirping crickets'. Sun, 15 Sep 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Waiheke Island vineyard company Cable Bay Wine has been found guilty of breaching allowable noise limits and faces a fine of up to $600,000.
Pizza Hut brings back all-you-can-eat buffet to celebrate 50th anniversary in New Zealand https://www.nzherald.co.nz/lifestyle/pizza-hut-brings-back-all-you-can-eat-buffet-to-celebrate-50th-anniversary-in-new-zealand/TI47TAIGXJAUDI5MUOP2KGQID4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/lifestyle/pizza-hut-brings-back-all-you-can-eat-buffet-to-celebrate-50th-anniversary-in-new-zealand/TI47TAIGXJAUDI5MUOP2KGQID4/ The pop-up will operate at City Works Depot in central Auckland for a limited period. Sun, 15 Sep 2024 19:43:54 +0000 Soft-serve ice cream is back on the menu when Pizza Hutt brings back its all-you-can-eat buffet for a short time.
Gangs Bill: Why a new move banning gang patches in a private home is causing an uproar https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/gangs-bill-why-a-new-move-banning-gang-patches-in-a-private-home-is-causing-an-uproar/ 6ZQFUWYKAZFLLLSXVGN2TLPBJY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/gangs-bill-why-a-new-move-banning-gang-patches-in-a-private-home-is-causing-an-uproar/ 6ZQFUWYKAZFLLLSXVGN2TLPBJY/ Derek ChengShould it be a jailable crime to have a gang patch in your house, even if it's not yours? Sun, 15 Sep 2024 17:00:00 +0000 A new clause in the Government's Gangs Bill will mean repeat offenders of the ban of gang patches in public places will be put under a "gang insignia prohibition order", meaning they won't be allowed a gang patch in their home for five years. Photo / Duncan Brown
Long haul for 31 dogs snatched from Whangārei: Police and SPCA investigating https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/long-haul-for-31-dogs-snatched-from-whangarei-police-and-spca-investigating/Z5QIX7S3AZEYZHOUQOZTYDGXBY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/long-haul-for-31-dogs-snatched-from-whangarei-police-and-spca-investigating/Z5QIX7S3AZEYZHOUQOZTYDGXBY/ Sarah CurtisThirty-one dogs and puppies were unlawfully taken from a Whangārei property. Sun, 15 Sep 2024 17:00:00 +0000 A Northland couple came home one day to find their 31 Cavalier King Charles spaniels and Cavoodles gone. They were later told the dogs were with an animal charity in Wellington called Helping You Help Animals (HUHANZ). Graphic / NZME
